title: A small cuboid that is 5 cm long, 2 cm wide, and 2 cm high is taken out from a large cube with an edge of 5 cm. What is the surface area of the remaining cube in square centimeters? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is more than one answer.Imagine Rubick’s cube 5x5. We can take out this cuboid in more than one way. Cube surface is 6*5*5=150cm^21. From the edge: cuboid and cube share 5cm edge.Area of remaining cube is smaller 150cm^2-2*2cm*2cm=142cm^2 2. From the side: cuboid and cube share 5x2 side of cuboid.Area=150–2*2*2+2*2*5=162 cm^2 3. From the side: cuboid and cube share 2x2 side of cuboid (hole in the cube).Area=150–2*2*2+4*2*5=182 cm^2 4. Cuboid’s aligment is tilted with angle compare to the sides and edges of the cube (not like Rubick cube). 5x2 squrae is inscribed in 5x5 square. One side of cuboid is element of cubes side but edges are at different angles…
